about_the_game:
The Prophecy



A name whispered since the time of the ancients, Necrymyr, a tyrannical Deity. Whose existence the human mind cannot fathom, rules over the dead souls of fallen warriors from all dimensions alike. It receives its power by feeding off of these departed spirits, forsaken to perish in battle, again and again. Unfortunate souls endlessly resurrected to be fed on once more.

Dominate Their Mind



Go head to head with Online PVP and defeat your friends with a superior strategy. Choose from 2 factions with a wide variety of unique abilities, to build an unstoppable force to outwit and overpower your enemy.

Diversify Your Playstyle



With a seemingly limitless amount of strategic possibilities, prepare your deckbuild for any situational encounter.

Current & Upcoming Key Features:



- Free to play. No pay to win!
- Deck-Building.
- Tug of War style gameplay.
- Duel Gamemode for battling friends!
- 1v1 PVP.
- Ranked, Casual Multiplayer Gamemodes.
- Singleplayer Bot Gamemode.
- Ranking system and leaderboards.
- 2 unique factions to choose from, each made up of 3 distinct unit types, with more to come.
- 90 abilities available, with more to come.
- 4 maps to play on, with more to come.
- Share your deck-build with other players.
- In-game store with cosmetic items available to customize your units and maps to stand out against your competitors.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7 (or higher)
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-750 Processor (8M Cache, 2.66 GHz)
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 980 or AMD equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 5 GB available space

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Breaking the limits of strategy games by hosting thousands of ability combinations. Soulless Legions is a Free-to-Play Online PVP 'Tug O' War' Combination Strategy game that allows players a lifetime of customization and strategic inquiry.
